subject: Returns Request - Order #SSN3637
description_text:
Order #SSN3637


Hi,

Please can you send me a shipping label so I can return the 2 VAM Pro
motors and power supply.

They are not working correctly. They work for 20 or 30 minutes then they
get stuck vibrating and only leaving them switched off for a day clears the
problem. The problem returns when using the next day. Re-starting the PC
and power does not help.

Also the control box sparks when the power is connected (see attached video
control box)

Ant one of the haptic motors also gives out a loud audible humming noise
when not in use (only one of the motors does this).
(see attached file - haptic buzz 2)


Kind Regards

R Jones

conversations.body_text: Hi Richard Jones,  If this happens, it indicates that the computer’s grounding is not reliable, possibly because a three-prong plug was not used with a three-prong wall outlet. You can refer to the post below: connect the computer case to the stand, and connect the control box to the metal screws on the pedals. This should resolve the disconnection issue.  https://github.com/SHWotever/SimHub/wiki/USB-Issues-Troubleshooting https://support.gomezsimindustries.com/portal/en/kb/articles/understanding-emi-and-grounding

Hi,

I have tried this but it does not work. The motors still buzz and just stop
working after 30 mins or so. I would like to return these for a refund
please.

Kind Regards,
Richard.

On Thu, 11 Dec 2025 at 01:22, service@simsonn.com

Hi Richard Jones,  Please take a photo of your control box, as the video you previously sent did not upload completely. Also, take a screenshot of the configuration interface in SIMSONN Manager. If the grounding is proper, disconnection issues should not occur. You can also use SimHub for telemetry monitoring.      Additionally, if you encounter disconnection issues, please make sure to connect the computer case, the control box casing, and the pedal’s metal screws together with a single wire for grounding. This can effectively prevent disconnections or interference.

Hi,

I have grounded the control box and have re-tested the motors - they still
do not work and still make a loud humming noise. The power is still
sparking when I plug it in after being grounded. I am fed up with messing
about with these now/ Please send a returns label so I can send these back
for a refund.

Pictures attached as requested

Hi Richard Jones,    Please update the software to Simsonn Manager 2.1.2, and upgrade the pedal firmware to CPU1: 2.0.5 and CPU2: 2.0.4, then perform the test again.

Thank you, I will do that. I will let you know when I have tested it.

I have tested the motors with the updates. The problem is the same, they
work for a few minutes then stop working or get stuck vibrating -= the
grounding is not helping, they hum just as loud.

Please can I return these. I would like a refund

wrote:

> Thank you, I will do that. I will let you know when I have tested it.
>

Hi Richard Jones,  The connection is incorrect. You need to connect the PC chassis, the control box screws, and the pedal metal screws together. The most important point is to ensure a reliable ground connection between the PC chassis and the control box screws. Please note that paint may affect grounding. If the issue persists, we can send you a replacement control box.
